creditline: Lent by James and Nancy McGlynn Phelps
description: oval canvas; nude male figure with red drape; figure stands with PL arm raised, PR hand holding horse bridle; dark horse rearing behind man to PL, brown horse at PR; ornate gold frame
marks: Signature and stickers Signature at bottom L edge, dark red: [HRegnault]
text: The larger version of this work, currently in the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston, was originally offered to the famed St. Paul art collector and railroad magnate, James J. Hill.
title: Automaton with the Horses of Achilles
